cab.content:
Col Jones
SECRET
?4794
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 10th JUNE 1918.
1. The enemy renewed his attacks on the MOYON - MONTDIDIER front last night, and has made some further progress. At 6 a.m. this morning our line ran approximately as follows :- PASSEL, VILLE, (both inclusive to the French) ORVAL,(German, L'ECOUVILLON (German, ELINCOURT (German), VANDELICOURT (French) ?GLISE(German), St MAUR (German), BELLOY (German), MERY, COURCELLES, LE PLOYRON, DO?FRONT, DOMELIEU, LE MANCHEL.
So far the French have captured about 1,000 prisoners. Probably 20 divisions have been employed by the Germans of which 11 have been identified.
2. On the rest of the front the situation remains unchanged
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
10th June 1918.
Issued at 12.50 p.m.
For the personal information - of the Minister only -
